I bought this app a few years ago to use with an old Canon t3i (with a TP-Link MR3040 for wifi). I have to say it gives terrific freedom being able to sit in the cool inside air and snap pictures with the phone when my camera is set to shoot wildlife outside.   As an fyi, this may have something to do with my Android version, but recently I'd been having a real issue getting the app to fully connect to the camera. It would say it saw a camera but would not connect. After hours spent experimenting, I found it was the phone connecting to the the tp-link that had an odd glitch. Because the tp-link wifi connection does not actually give internet access, the phone would connect fine but then after a few seconds it would give a pop-up saying the connection had no internet access. The problem was I had to click "YES" to close that pop-up! If I simply went on into the app it would never finally connect to the camera. All the times I ignored it and it went away by itself, it wouldn't connect. So, clicking "yes" on the pop-up makes it work now every time. (Note: clicking the check box in the pop-up will avoid all this! :)

We already use Wireless AV transmitters which is expensive but high quality(full frame speeds)video for director station viewing.  This is a nice cost alternative...for wi-fi use, you're spending $48(router & app) compared to $300-$3,000 for an AV-transmitters that doesn't control the camera.  One other device out there does control the camera wireless but cost about $300 and performs about the same. I had wrote before how this started out being a great app for my Canon EOS 7D mark II. But once I purchased the W-E1 WiFi SD card it no longer worked for me. I thought it was an incompatibility issue with the app. Therefore I  gave it a lower rating simply because of that. But it turns out not to be the case. While the WiFi SD card is inserted, the USB is disabled. The WiFi SD card has to be removed in order to enable the USB transmission. Once done, the app come up again and works just fine. So my apologies to the developers of this app. That was a mistake on my part. The only thing I see as a weakness is the small latency that can occur. But that is NOT an app issue, that is simply the draw back of sending video over USB. Painfully slow when switching screens. In Full Screen the app still doesn't use entire screen, leaving navigation bar. I am one of many people who just need an image review (follow shot) app without Live View functionality. Maybe you would consider spinning that off as separate app? Hard to believe that such a frequently used feature of tethered shooting, a staple of EOS Utility, so hard to find for android - DSLR Controller by far the best attempt so far.  I'll test a bit more but not sure if it's a keeper in it's present state.

If you want to review previous images, use Follow Shot in Gallery mode. Navigation bar cannot be hidden - Android limitation, not an app bug. If you email support maybe something can be done with this.

Asus Transformer + Canon 450D. It works, but that's about all I can say about it... lacks polish, UI could be a little better, and doesn't actually take a picture, it says "Camera failed". With all that said... I'm REALLY looking forward to this when it comes out.

I'm giving it five stars because it's awesome, but unfortunately I have to uninstall it because it doesn't work with the Canon EOS Rebel XTi. Must have something to do with the fact that there is no live display on that dinosaur. I will shop this to my fotog friends, though! XOOM

Great work there, I bought the app and it works great on Samsung Galaxy S2 (2.3.4) and EOS 550D. While it has very little basic options, I propose you really start doing on stuff you already have on "to-do" list and here are even more ideas: - saving images/video to mobile phone - direct sending images/video over wifi/3g to web hosts (facebook/dropbox...etc) (with an option of making smaller preview picture) - live web broadcast through mobile internet/wifi with use of Ustream/others... - timer and more <3
Perfect on Asus Transformer + 5d mark II

With my 40D and Galaxy Tab 10.1 with USB adapter I get a live view feed, the ability to tune focus (using the arrows not the touch feature), change various settings include WB, Drive, & ISO. I couldn't turn on the histogram or the grid overlay... and most importantly I couldn't take a photo (yeah it's a HUGE bug, but it is BETA). But immediately my mind started racing with possibilities... Scripting? Auto-Sharing? Calibration Tools? Cinematography? I look forward to the future of this app and other cameras.
Works quite well for a beta. Worth the $8 once you consider how much a remote is from Canon and it offers MUCH more.
Works perfectly between a Canon EOS 7D and an Asus Eee Pad Transformer with the USB cable connected on the keyboard dock!
Awesome! Works with Asus eee Transformer tablet & Dock Station (USB only on dock) connected to Canon T3i. Nice job !!

My Xoom connected right away to my Rebel XTi, and I could control most variables remotely, yay! However, looks like it really wants a live-view camera, since it failed whenever I tried taking pictures. (I know the XTi doesn't support live-view, but was hoping it would at least take pictures blindly onto CF card and pull them over PTP for examination.) Regardless, fully featured and very cool app if you have the right camera.
Works wonderfully
Already working quite well. Keep it up!

Chainfire is known for doing some amazing things, but this takes the cake in my opinion and the app is only BETA so far. I can't wait to see what kind of goodies he adds. It's working wonderfully with my Toshiba Thrive tablet and Cannon Rebel EOS T1i. Thanks a ton for this incredible app Chainfire!

Even though this is still in Beta, it works perfectly with my Canon 50D DSLR and my Motorola Xoom. I can now use all of the Live View functions of the camera on my Xoom without having to carry a bulky laptop around. Can't wait for the production release, and would also love to be able to store the photos directly on the Xoom rather than having to transfer them manually.
